etymology.description: Originally a carriage seen from above with large wheels and a sun shade -> vertical strokes represent wheels and loading area -> depicts a vehicle
etymology.interpretation: The character 車(車) (chē, "vehicle") visually represents a traditional carriage, with its design evolving into a more simplified vertical depiction over time.

examples.chinese: 这是一辆电动的车(這是一輛電動的車)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè shì yī liàng diàndòng de chē.

examples.chinese: 我在车站等车(我在車站等車)，准备乘车(準備乘車)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zài chēzhàn děng chē, zhǔnbèi chéng chē.
examples.english: I wait at the station for the bus, and I am ready to board.

examples.chinese: 他开车回家(他開車回家)，沿途欣赏风景(沿途欣賞風景)。
examples.pinyin: Tā kāi chē huí jiā, yán tú xīnshǎng fēngjǐng.
examples.english: He drives home, enjoying the scenery along the way.
